author: NASS
description:
I colorized, restored, and created a sound design for this video of Boston and its surroundings that played a crucial role in the American Revolution, highlighting their historical and symbolic significance. It features sites such as Faneuil Hall, known as the “Cradle of Liberty,” King’s Chapel, the site of the Boston Massacre, Paul Revere’s House, and the Old North Church where the famous signal lanterns were displayed. It also covers Lexington and Concord, where the first blood of the Revolution was shed on April 19, 1775, with monuments commemorating the Minutemen, Captain Parker, and the first martyrs of liberty. Through scenes of streets, cemeteries, monuments, and historic buildings

B&W Source Before & After Restoration 4:37 - 9:07

Video Restoration Process:
✔ FPS boosted to 60 frames per second 
✔ Image resolution boosted up to HD 
✔ Improved video sharpness and brightness 
✔ Colorized only for the ambiance (not historically accurate)
✔added sound design only for the ambiance
title: 1920s - Boston in Color, Street Scene [60fps,Remastered] w/sound design added
